entry.title: New release for Rallly: v3.10.1
entry.content:
What's Changed

Fixed an issue where guest users would not get emails in their preferred language.

Note: The fix will only work for new guests and will not retroactively update an existing guest user's preferred locale.

Full Changelog: https://github.com/lukevella/rallly/compare/v3.10.0...v3.10.1

entry.title: New release for Rallly: v4.0.0
entry.content:
This major update brings a refreshed user experience, new features for self-hosted instances, and significant improvements under the hood.

[!IMPORTANT]
Before upgrading to Rallly v4.0.0, we strongly recommend backing up your database. While we've tested the upgrade process, a backup ensures you can restore your data in case of any unforeseen issues during the migration.

âœ¨ Key Highlights:

ğŸ¨ Updated User Interface

Rallly has a new look! We've refreshed the UI to make it more modern, intuitive, and easier to navigate.

ğŸ’° Monetization for Multi-User Self-Hosted Setups

To support the continued development and sustainability of Rallly, we're introducing a licensing model for multi-user self-hosted instances.

  • Personal (single-user) setups remain completely free!
  • For multi-user deployments, we now offer the option to pay for a license:
  • For more details, please see our Licensing documentation.

â˜ï¸ S3 Storage Support

You can now configure Rallly to use Amazon S3 (or S3-compatible services eg. minio). Check out the S3 Configuration documentation

âš™ï¸ New Control Panel

A new Control Panel has been added for instance administrators. This panel allows for easier management of:

  • Users and their roles
  • License activation and status
  • Check out the documentation for how to access the Control Panel

Full Changelog: https://github.com/lukevella/rallly/compare/v3.11.2...v4.0.0
